metadata.title: CVE-2016-5191 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Bookmark handling in Google Chrome prior to 54.0.2840.59 for Windows, Mac,and Linux; 54.0.2840.85 for Android had insufficient validation of supplieddata, which allowed a remote attacker to inject arbitrary scripts or HTML(UXSS) via crafted HTML pages, as demonstrated by an interpretationconflict between userinfo and scheme in anhttp://javascript:payload@example.com URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-browser-l10n - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-chromedriver - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263').
